children.value: A curated list of awesome resources for learning and using lattice-based cryptography.
The LLL Algorithm: Survey and Applications
Lattice Basis Reduction: An Introduction to the LLL Algorithm and Its Applications
Complexity of Lattice Problems: A Cryptographic Perspective
Introduction to Lattice-Based Cryptography (Bar-Ilan Winter School)
Prepping for post-quantum: a beginner’s guide to lattice cryptography
Windows on Theory (Blog posts on LWE, etc.)
Real World Crypto Symposium Talks (Search for lattice topics)
Generating hard instances of lattice problems
On Lattices, Learning with Errors, Random Linear Codes, and Cryptography
On Ideal Lattices and Learning with Errors over Rings
Vadim Lyubashevsky, Chris Peikert, Oded Regev
NTRU: A Ring-Based Public Key Cryptosystem
Jeffrey Hoffstein, Jill Pipher, Joseph H. Silverman
Post-quantum key exchange - a new hope
Erdem Alkim, Léo Ducas, Thomas Pöppelmann, Peter Schwabe
CRYSTALS-Kyber: Algorithm Specifications and Supporting Documentation
Trapdoors for Hard Lattices and New Cryptographic Constructions
Craig Gentry, Chris Peikert, Vinod Vaikuntanathan
Falcon: Fast-Fourier Lattice-based Compact Signatures over NTRU
CRYSTALS-Dilithium: Algorithm Specifications and Supporting Documentation
Fully homomorphic encryption using ideal lattices
(Leveled) fully homomorphic encryption without modulus switching
Homomorphic Encryption from Learning with Errors: Conceptually-Simpler, Asymptotically-Faster, Attribute-Based
Craig Gentry, Amit Sahai, Brent Waters
TFHE: Fast Fully Homomorphic Encryption over the Torus
Ilaria Chillotti, Nicolas Gama, Mariya Georgieva, Malika Izabachène
PALISADE Team (NJIT, Duality Technologies, et al.)
Includes implementations of NIST PQC candidates
Fast FHE libraries based on GSW/torus
Go library for lattice crypto, including HE
Contributions welcome! Please open an issue or pull request to suggest additions or corrections.

MG02a.label: MG02a
MG02a.html: Micciancio, D., & Goldwasser, S. (2002). Lattice Basis Reduction: An Introduction to the LLL Algorithm and Its Applications. Springer. 10.1007/978-1-4615-0715-9

MG02b.label: MG02b
MG02b.html: Micciancio, D., & Goldwasser, S. (2002). Complexity of Lattice Problems: A Cryptographic Perspective. Springer. 10.1007/978-1-4615-0897-7

Ajt96.label: Ajt96
Ajt96.html: Ajtai, M. (1996). Generating hard instances of lattice problems. STOC ’96: Proceedings of the Twenty-Eighth Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing, 99–108. 10.1145/237814.237838

Reg05.label: Reg05
Reg05.html: Regev, O. (2005). On Lattices, Learning with Errors, Random Linear Codes, and Cryptography. STOC ’05: Proceedings of the Thirty-Seventh Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing, 84–93. 10.1145/1060590.1060603

Reg10.label: Reg10
Reg10.html: Regev, O. (2010). The Learning with Errors Problem. \\urlhttps://cims.nyu.edu/ regev/papers/lwesurvey.pdf.

LPR10.label: LPR10
LPR10.html: Lyubashevsky, V., Peikert, C., & Regev, O. (2010). On Ideal Lattices and Learning with Errors over Rings. In H. Gilbert (Ed.), Advances in Cryptology – EUROCRYPT 2010 (Vol. 6110, pp. 1–23). Springer. 10.1007/978-3-642-13190-5_1

HPS98.label: HPS98
HPS98.html: Hoffstein, J., Pipher, J., & Silverman, J. H. (1998). NTRU: A Ring-Based Public Key Cryptosystem. In J. P. Buhler (Ed.), Algorithmic Number Theory, ANTS-III (Vol. 1423, pp. 267–288). Springer. 10.1007/BFb0054868

ADPS15.label: ADPS15
ADPS15.html: Alkim, E., Ducas, L., P\\"oppelmann, T., & Schwabe, P. (2015). Post-quantum key exchange - a new hope. Cryptology ePrint Archive, Report 2015/1092. https://eprint.iacr.org/2015/1092

Kyb17.label: Kyb17
Kyb17.html: Kyber Team. (2017–Present). CRYSTALS-Kyber: Algorithm Specifications and Supporting Documentation. \\urlhttps://pq-crystals.org/kyber/.

GPV08.label: GPV08
GPV08.html: Gentry, C., Peikert, C., & Vaikuntanathan, V. (2008). Trapdoors for Hard Lattices and New Cryptographic Constructions. STOC ’08: Proceedings of the 40th Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing, 197–206. 10.1145/1374376.1374407

Fal17.label: Fal17
Fal17.html: Falcon Team. (2017–Present). Falcon: Fast-Fourier Lattice-based Compact Signatures over NTRU. \\urlhttps://falcon-sign.info/.

Dil17.label: Dil17
Dil17.html: Dilithium Team. (2017–Present). CRYSTALS-Dilithium: Algorithm Specifications and Supporting Documentation. \\urlhttps://pq-crystals.org/dilithium/.

Gen09.label: Gen09
Gen09.html: Gentry, C. (2009). Fully homomorphic encryption using ideal lattices. STOC ’09: Proceedings of the 41st Annual ACM Symposium on Theory of Computing, 169–178. 10.1145/1536414.1536440

BV11.label: BV11
BV11.html: Brakerski, Z., & Vaikuntanathan, V. (2011). Fully Homomorphic Encryption without Bootstrapping. Cryptology ePrint Archive, Report 2011/277. https://eprint.iacr.org/2011/277

Bra12.label: Bra12
Bra12.html: Brakerski, Z. (2012). (Leveled) fully homomorphic encryption without modulus switching. Cryptology ePrint Archive, Report 2011/344. https://eprint.iacr.org/2011/344

GSW13.label: GSW13
GSW13.html: Gentry, C., Sahai, A., & Waters, B. (2013). Homomorphic Encryption from Learning with Errors: Conceptually-Simpler, Asymptotically-Faster, Attribute-Based. Cryptology ePrint Archive, Report 2013/340. https://eprint.iacr.org/2013/340

CGGI16.label: CGGI16
CGGI16.html: Chillotti, I., Gama, N., Georgieva, M., & Izabach\\`ene, M. (2016). TFHE: Fast Fully Homomorphic Encryption over the Torus. Cryptology ePrint Archive, Report 2016/421. https://eprint.iacr.org/2016/421
